content.data:
[Y]Z80 Memory Map
[W]The 64K view from the CPU.
[c][m.]
[W]The Z80 sees address space from 0000h
[W]to FFFFh, with ROM and RAM visibility
[W]controlled by hardware state.
[W]Treat memory layout as a map before
[W]coding, especially when mixing
[W]firmware and custom routines.
[c][m.]
[G]- 0000-3FFF often lower ROM.
[G]- 4000-BFFF core RAM.
[G]- C000-FFFF may expose upper ROM.
[m][m-]
[Y]TABLE
[C]Sketch your active map per routine to
[C]avoid collisions.
[c][m.]
[C]0 MAIN   [W]# HELP
